nodes.documentation:
@dev Gets the active stake balance of the specified address.
An active stake is a stake that passed the initialization period.
Also, the operator had to approve the specified operator contract.
     * The difference between eligible stake is that active stake does not make
the operator eligible for work selection but it may be still finishing
earlier work during undelegation period. Operator with a minimum required
amount of active stake can join the network but cannot be selected to any
new work.
     * @param _operator address of stake operator.
@param _operatorContract address of operator contract.
@return an uint256 representing the eligible stake balance.

nodes.documentation:
@dev Gets the active stake balance of the specified address.
An active stake is a stake that passed the initialization period.
Also, the operator had to approve the specified operator contract.
     * The difference between eligible stake is that active stake does not make
the operator eligible for work selection but it may be still finishing
earlier work during undelegation period. Operator with a minimum required
amount of active stake can join the network but cannot be selected to any
new work.
     * @param _operator address of stake operator.
@param _operatorContract address of operator contract.
@return an uint256 representing the eligible stake balance.
nodes.name: activeStake

devdoc.details: A token staking contract for a specified standard ERC20Burnable token. A holder of the specified token can stake delegate its tokens to this contract and recover the stake after undelegation period is over.

activeStake(address,address).details: Gets the active stake balance of the specified address. An active stake is a stake that passed the initialization period. Also, the operator had to approve the specified operator contract.     * The difference between eligible stake is that active stake does not make the operator eligible for work selection but it may be still finishing earlier work during undelegation period. Operator with a minimum required amount of active stake can join the network but cannot be selected to any new work.
activeStake(address,address).return: an uint256 representing the eligible stake balance.

authorizeOperatorContract(address,addres.details: Authorizes operator contract to access staked token balance of the provided operator. Can only be executed by stake operator authorizer.

authorizerOf(address).details: Gets the authorizer for the specified operator address.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the stake balance of the specified address.

params._address: The address to query the balance of.

balanceOf(address).return: An uint256 representing the amount staked by the passed address.

constructor.details: Creates a token staking contract for a provided Standard ERC20Burnable token.

params._initializationPeriod: To avoid certain attacks on work selection, recently created operators must wait for a specific period of time before being eligible for work selection.
params._registry: Address of a keep registry that will be linked to this contract.
params._tokenAddress: Address of a token that will be linked to this contract.
params._undelegationPeriod: The staking contract guarantees that an undelegated operators stakes will stay locked for a number of blocks after undelegation, and thus available as collateral for any work the operator is engaged in.

eligibleStake(address,address).details: Gets the eligible stake balance of the specified address. An eligible stake is a stake that passed the initialization period and is not currently undelegating. Also, the operator had to approve the specified operator contract.     * Operator with a minimum required amount of eligible stake can join the network and participate in new work selection.
eligibleStake(address,address).return: an uint256 representing the eligible stake balance.

getUndelegation(address).return: amount The amount the given operator will be able to recover once undelegation period has passed.undelegatedAt The time of undelegate request used to determine when the undelegation period has passed.

magpieOf(address).details: Gets the magpie for the specified operator address.

operatorsOf(address).details: Gets the list of operators of the specified address.

ownerOf(address).details: Gets the stake owner for the specified operator address.

receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,.details: Makes sure provided token contract is the same one linked to this contract.

params._extraData: Data for stake delegation. This byte array must have the following values concatenated: Magpie address (20 bytes) where the rewards for participation are sent, operator's (20 bytes) address, authorizer (20 bytes) address.
params._from: The owner of the tokens who approved them to transfer.
params._value: Approved amount for the transfer and stake.

seize(uint256,uint256,address,address[]).details: Seize provided token amount from every member in the misbehaved operators array. The tattletale is rewarded with 5% of the total seized amount scaled by the reward adjustment parameter and the rest 95% is burned.

params.amount: Token amount to seize from every misbehaved operator.
params.misbehavedOperators: Array of addresses to seize the tokens from.
params.rewardMultiplier: Reward adjustment in percentage. Min 1% and 100% max.

slash(uint256,address[]).details: Slash provided token amount from every member in the misbehaved operators array and burn 100% of all the tokens.

params.amount: Token amount to slash from every misbehaved operator.
params.misbehavedOperators: Array of addresses to seize the tokens from.

devdoc.title: TokenStaking

cancelStake(address).notice: Cancels stake of tokens within the operator initialization period without being subjected to the token lockup for the undelegation period. This can be used to undo mistaken delegation to the wrong operator address.

receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,.notice: Receives approval of token transfer and stakes the approved amount.

recoverStake(address).notice: Recovers staked tokens and transfers them back to the owner. Recovering tokens can only be performed when the operator is finished undelegating.

undelegate(address).notice: Undelegates staked tokens. You will be able to recover your stake by calling `recoverStake()` with operator address once undelegation period is over.
